skill.name: post-impl-docs
skill.description: Update repository documentation after code implementation. Maintains README, CHANGELOG, docs/ folder, and inline docstrings based on changes made. Triggered by lane-executor after task completion.
skill.summary: Automatically update repository documentation after code changes. Keeps README, CHANGELOG, docs/, and docstrings in sync.
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Documentation skill containing cookbook reference material. All static findings are false positives - the skill contains markdown documentation with git command examples, changelog format references, and placeholder code blocks that triggered pattern matching but pose no security risk.

content.user_title: Keep documentation in sync with code
content.value_statement: Documentation often falls out of sync with code changes. This skill automatically updates README, CHANGELOG, docs folder, and inline docstrings to reflect implemented changes.
actual_capabilities: Analyze code changes using git diff to understand what was modified
Update README.md with new features, APIs, and usage examples
Add properly formatted entries to CHANGELOG.md following conventional formats
Scan docs/ folder for references to changed symbols and update them
Update inline docstrings for modified functions and classes
limitations: Does not generate new documentation from scratch - only updates existing docs
Cannot verify the accuracy of technical content in documentation
Requires git repository with changes to analyze

use_cases.title: Maintain accurate CHANGELOGs
use_cases.description: After implementing features or fixes, automatically add properly formatted changelog entries following conventional commit standards.
use_cases.target_user: Developers who want to maintain clean, organized changelogs

use_cases.title: Keep README synchronized
use_cases.description: Update feature lists, API sections, and usage examples in README.md when new code is added to the codebase.
use_cases.target_user: Open source maintainers keeping documentation current

use_cases.title: Update inline documentation
use_cases.description: Synchronize docstrings with code changes to ensure function descriptions, parameters, and return values stay accurate.

prompt_templates.title: Basic documentation update
prompt_templates.prompt: Update documentation after the recent implementation. Analyze the git diff to understand what changed. Update README.md with any new features, add changelog entries to CHANGELOG.md, and update docstrings for modified functions.

prompt_templates.title: Breaking change documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Document a breaking change. Update README migration guides, add breaking change notice to CHANGELOG, update all affected docstrings, and flag documentation in docs/ folder for review.
prompt_templates.description: Document a breaking change. Update README migration guides, add breaking change notice to CHANGELOG, update all affected docstrings, and flag documentation in docs/ folder for review.

prompt_templates.title: API addition documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Add documentation for new API endpoints. Update README API section, add usage examples, create docstrings for new functions, and add corresponding CHANGELOG entry.
prompt_templates.description: Add documentation for new API endpoints. Update README API section, add usage examples, create docstrings for new functions, and add corresponding CHANGELOG entry.
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding new public API methods to a library

prompt_templates.title: Full documentation audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform comprehensive documentation review. Analyze all changed files, update docs/ references to changed symbols, verify docstring accuracy, and generate a complete documentation update report.
prompt_templates.description: Perform comprehensive documentation review. Analyze all changed files, update docs/ references to changed symbols, verify docstring accuracy, and generate a complete documentation update report.

best_practices: Run this skill after completing implementation but before committing to ensure documentation is current
Configure CHANGELOG_FORMAT variable to match your project's changelog style (conventional, keep-a-changelog, or simple)
Set COMMIT_DOCS=true to automatically commit documentation changes with code
anti_patterns: Running documentation updates without first analyzing the actual code changes
Adding CHANGELOG entries for trivial changes like typo fixes
Updating docstrings without verifying the function behavior actually changed

faq.question: Does this skill create new documentation files?
faq.answer: No. This skill updates existing documentation (README, CHANGELOG, docs/ files, docstrings). It does not generate new documentation from scratch.

faq.question: What changelog formats are supported?
faq.answer: Three formats are supported: conventional (Angular-style), keep-a-changelog (Keep a Changelog standard), and simple (basic markdown list).

faq.question: Does it commit changes automatically?
faq.answer: Set COMMIT_DOCS=true to auto-commit documentation changes. Default is true. Changes are committed separately from code.

faq.question: What happens if there are no code changes?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes the git diff. If no changes are detected, it returns a no_changes status indicating documentation impact is none.

faq.question: Can it update documentation for any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works with any language. Docstring templates for Python and TypeScript/JavaScript are included in the cookbook.

faq.question: How does it know which docs to update?
faq.answer: It scans docs/ folder using grep to find references to changed functions/classes, then updates only affected documentation.
